class.name: Ardent
class.shortfluff: You fill your allies with with the will to fight and the clarity of purpose needed for victory. When you attack, you loose thoughts that intensify emotions and lay bare truths, infecting your enemies with doubt and filling your allies with confidence.
class.fluff: Those who let their base emotions rule them invite madness and destruction. Prolonged feelings of fear, greed, lust, or hatred can weaken the mind's defenses against manipulation. Wielding psionic power, an Ardent excites such emotions in his or her enemies, creating gaps in their defenses and frustrating their attacks, all while filling his or her allies with encouraging thoughts and guarding them against despair and other negative emotions.

Ardents rarely learn their art through formal training. In many ways, they are incidental leaders, having stumbled onto psionic power at some point earlier in their lives. How an Excitant discovered his or her psionic talent can shape how one wields this power now. He or she might have awakened to the talent in the heat of battle, experiencing a mental breakthrough that allowed him or her to augment attacks by rending the enemies' minds. Or an Excitant's friends might reflect his or her power when the Excitant's mood bleeds into theirs, altering their emotional states to match his or her own. Regardless of the revelation, an Ardent learned to harness this power to support his or her fighting prowess and to guide allies to victory.

feature.name: Ardent Mantle
feature.benefit: A person's state of mind can be armor against the decay and madness born from base emotions, and thus Ardents gird themselves by donning particular mindsets to ward off the perils brought on by fear, despair and hatred. These emotional states are known as mantles.
Choose Mantle of Clarity, Mantle of Elation, or Mantle of Impusiveness as your mantle.
Bonuses granted by multiple Ardent Mantles are not cumulative, only the highest bonus applies.

subfeature.name: Mantle of Clarity
subfeature.benefit: An Excitant with the Mantle of Clarity reads his or her enemies' weaknesses and reveals them to allies, and uses keen insight to help allies overcome adversity.
You have an Aura 5 (Psionic). You and each ally in the aura gain a bonus to all defenses against opportunity attacks.
Each ally in the aura also gains a +2 bonus to Insight checks and to Perception checks.
Also, you gain the ardent alacrity class power.

power.title: Ardent Alacrity
power.fluff: As you take a hit, your emotional energy inspires your allies

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Each target can use a free reaction to either shift 1 square or to move half his or her speed.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Shift 2 squares of move half his or her speed.

subfeature.name: Mantle of Elation
subfeature.benefit: A Mantle of Elation Excitant can scarcely contain the emotions that strain against his or her will like a crashing tide. When he or she attacks, the emotions flood out of him or her, increasing allies' confidence and washing away enemies' courage.

You have an Aura 5 (Psionic). You and each ally in the aura gain a bonus to damage rolls with opportunity attacks. The bonus equals your Constitution modifier, and increases to 2 + your Constitution modifier at 11th level, and to 4 + your Constitution modifier at 21st level.
Each ally in the aura also gains a +2 bonus to Diplomacy checks and Intimidate checks.
Also, you gain the ardent outrage class power.

power.title: Ardent Outrage
power.fluff: As you take a hit, your anger unbalances your foes

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Each target grants combat advantage until the start of the acting creature's next turn.

subfeature.name: Mantle of Impulsiveness
subfeature.benefit: An Excitant with the Mantle of Impulsiveness has little use for caution or careful planning, and he or she allows natural talent and fate to guide his or her actions in improving allies' attacks and stripping away enemies' protections.

You have an Aura 5 (Psionic). When you or an ally in the aura is targeted by an opportunity attack, that character gains a bonus to all damage rolls until the end of his or her next turn. The bonus equals one-half your Constitution modifier, and increases to 1 + one-half your Constitution modifier at 11th level, and to 2 + one-half your Constitution modifier at 21st level.
Each ally in the aura also gains a +2 bonus to Endurance checks and Intimidate checks.
Also, you gain the ardent eruption class power.

power.title: Ardent Eruption
power.fluff: Your pain bleeds from you in a wave, touching your allies and lending new ferocity to their attacks

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Each target gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls until the end of his or her next turn.

feature.name: Ardent Surge
feature.benefit: An Excitant's advanced emotional state is inspirational, motivating his or her allies and, with the addition of a little psionic energy, helping them recover from injuries.
You gain the ardent surge class power.

power.title: Ardent Surge
power.fluff: You send a surge of powerful emotion that revives a faltering ally

section.name: Target:
section.text: You or one ally in the burst

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to his or her healing surge value plus an additional 1d6 hit points.

section.name: Mantle of Clarity:
section.text: The target gains a +1 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Mantle of Elation:
section.text: The target gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Mantle of Impulsiviness:
section.text: The target gains a +2 bonus to speed until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can use this power twice per encounter, but only once per round.

feature.name: Mind is Willing
feature.benefit: An Excitant's influence is such that when his or her allies' bodies grow weak, their minds are strong enough to push them on.

During a short rest, your allies regain additional hit points. For the first healing surge each ally spends during the short rest, he or she regains additional hit points equal to one-half his or her healing surge value.

feature.name: Psionic Augmentation
feature.benefit: Through discipline and careful study, an Ardent masters a form of psionic magic that offers greater versatility than other characters command. He or she knows a broad array of at-will powers, each of which is a conduit through which he or she pours as much or as little psionic energy as desired.

You channel psionic energy from a reservoir of personal power -represented in the game as power points- that you can use to augment your at-will attack powers, replacing the encounter attack powers that other characters use. Because of this, you acquire and use powers in a slightly different manner from how most other classes do.

At-Will Attack Powers: At 1st level, you choose two at-will attack powers and one daily attack power from your class, but you don't start with any encounter attack powers from your class. You can instead augment your class at-will attack powers using power points. These powers have the Augmentable keyword.

You gain new at-will attack powers from this class, instead of new encounter attack powers, as you increase in level. At 3rd level and 7th level, you choose a new at-will attack power of that level or lower from this class. At 13th, 17th, 23rd, and 27th level, you can replace one of your at-will attack powers with another one of your level or lower. Both the replaced power and the new power must be Augmentable and from this class.

Power Points: You start with 2 power points. You gain 2 additional power points at 3rd, 7th, and 13th level, and 3 additional power points at 17th, 23rd, and 27th level. If you gain power points from another source (such as your paragon path), add them to your power point total. You can use your power points to augment any Augmentable power you have, regardless of how you gained the power.
You regain all your power points when you take a short or an extended rest, or when an effect allows you to regain all your expended encounter attack powers.

If an effect allows you to regain a single expended encounter attack power of a given level, you instead regain a number of power points equal to the highest augment option you have of that level or lower.
